intro: Cacalia araneosa, commonly known as the spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cacalia araneosa is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
